website_summaries.verdict: The Asus RT-AC66U is an excellent router and is currently one of the best options among those that support the latest 802.11ac Wi-Fi standard.
pros: The Asus RT-AC66U 802.11ac Dual-Band Wireless-AC1750 Gigabit Router offers great performance on the 5GHz frequency band, and lots of features for homes and businesses
cons: The Asus RT-AC66U runs rather hot, and is relatively expensive

customer_reviews.title: This could have been great if it actually worked
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this router. The ONLY reason I ordered this was for VPN client on the router itself. This router does that, and is super easy to set up. The problem was that it wasn't stable. It worked great for 24 hours. Then after that there was a new firmware update. I installed the new firmware BEFORE reading online about some bad firmware updates. I think that this was my problem because after the update it would drop wired and wireless connections at random. I am returning this router. I have been able to manually configure a VPN on my Asus RT-AC1200, by using the WAN connection, and using PPTP.
customer_reviews.author: Heavy G

customer_reviews.title: SLOW Usb!
customer_reviews.text: Wireless seems to work OK. Network signal doesn't seem as strong as with my previous AC68U. Doesn't seem to want to show my network drive as available on the other computers (didn;t have that issue with the AC68U). The biggest issues is the USB 3.0 port. Cannot ever get better than 10 or 11 MBps and is usually in the 8 range. Basically getting USB 2.0 speed. Makes it basically useless for file sharing which was the point of having the USB ports. The port may be USB 3.0 compliant, but it sure doesn't get the throughput. Its like putting 200 mph tires on a Smart Car. Yes the tires can to it but the car sure can't.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: worked for three ears now wi-rfi is dead
customer_reviews.text: The last Wi-Fi router I bought lasted 8 years and the only reason I replaced it was I wanted to upgrade to a dual band router. This router worked well for the first year or so then Wi-Fi got spotty at best. This year the Wi-Fi can barely stand up on its own. Instead of getting download reads of 25 or 30 is now 122 megabits per second. One would think that it would last as long as the old Motorola did. I think I will be going back to Motorola for a replacement since this one is out of warranty and I don't want to go through the same problems all over again a few years down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Misterfixit1

customer_reviews.title: My TV streaming program keeps dropping out
customer_reviews.text: I had a RT-66N which die on me after two years and I bought this RT-66AC to improve data rate. It was working good for about 3 months then the fearsome dropping out and resetting started happening, at first rarely, then after a while has to reset every few hours while watching streaming TV. To avoid wifi dropout, I even ran a ethernet line from the router directly to my Apple TV. Didn't seem to help. Seems like Asus quality and reliability have degraded in recent years. I am looking at other brands before this one completely dies.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Gets fkaky sometines, but is working ok.
customer_reviews.text: Alot of issued with the 192.268.1.1 control panel not being able to be accessed through firefox, but a reboot cures that (3+ times a day. What happened ASUS? I've hadto return 3 ASUS routers kocally and through Amazon the last 2 weeks due to huge issues with nonworking routers after my top of the line $300 ASUS died in just 10 months. Next time I have to change brands, ASUS has NO quality control anymore. Awful!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Adam

customer_reviews.title: IPv6 does not actually work
customer_reviews.text: I have had good success with this router for quite a while. However, even with the latest firmware 3.0.0.4.382_51640 as of November 2019, IPv6 does not work on this router when "Pass-through" mode is enabled. In the "Native" mode it only works for a few minutes then shuts off. I have seen other forum posts were user have similar experience. With ISPs offering dual-stack, most won't notice any issues, but you are losing out on the IPv6 connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Senthil Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 2 years (July 2017-July 2019)
customer_reviews.text: Router worked awesome the first year, it was fast and distance was pretty good in my large home. About 8 months started noticing the router dropping hardwire connections once a month. Now 2 years later, the router only keeps connections for 30 minutes before rebooting. Updating the firmware did nothing to improve. Really liked the router but the reliability will get me to look at another manufacture unless ASUS will RMA a new one.
customer_reviews.author: BCarl

customer_reviews.title: Worst Router I've ever had the Displeasure of Using
customer_reviews.text: I have had 4 of these, 2 of them RMA replacements from ASUS. All of them have been failing in measures only referred to as spectacular, and never with any obvious reason. The 5 Ghz channel on my last two has been intermittent. This is with the replacement. ASUS tech support NEVER got back to me on this claim. I woke up this morning to see it had wiped my settings for no apparent reason and its behavior is erratic.
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: Was good for a couple of years.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second asus ac66 unit. The access point seem to have an issue with longevity. My second unit started dropping signal after couple or years. Nothing changed in setting or around the unit. It simply started dropping signal, and signal strength went down a lot. First unit died after couple of years as well. But it was and older model and it was time to replace it anyway. Still deciding if I should go through the RMA hustle or simply get a better product.
customer_reviews.author: KatyaB

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have AiProtection by Trend Micro
customer_reviews.text: 1 Star because it doesn't have an advertised feature: AiProtection by Trend Micro. I purchased this router specifically for that feature. e-mail from Asus: " Good Day! Thank you for taking the time communicating with us. We are very sorry to hear that our ASUS product did not meet your expectations. We deeply value your relationship with ASUS and are committed to providing you with the highest level of service simply because our customers deserve the very best. Regarding your query about the aiprotection feature, unfortunately, this is not part of the feature of this router under the specifications. "
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Like This One.  An Excellent Choice For The Avid ROKU User.
customer_reviews.text: Retired my old d-Link because it couldn't stream to even one ROKU; too much jitter and buffering. This router streams to two ROKUs (simultaneously) flawlessly while handling phone traffic (VoIP) and Internet surfing. Range is excellent. It's a tad expensive but for what you get, it's a great buy. I also like that it has a power switch on the back .. for turning off the router at night for enhanced security. Helps to keep hackers out that way ... yes? *********************************************************************** 11-18-2019. Update. Still using this thing without any problems. Been super reliable, streams NetFlix to two TVs simultaneously while updating 3 PCs with Windows updates. No skip or stutter (buffering issues). A very good unit.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Featureful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router based on reviews I’d read in some computer magazines and it has lived up to its billing. It’s fast, feature-laden and relatively inexpensive. I use only a small fraction of all of its features but they were easy to setup and the performance has been impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Reliable as well as good
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these in July of 2013 and it still works like new, and it worked well when it was new. I have given it bigger antenni oner the years and that improves the already acceptable signal a little in the kitchen, where the refrigerator blocks and diffracts the waves. Also, ASUS keeps the firmware current to help prevent the router being compromised by the bad guys. I probably reviewed this thing before but finding that review to update it is pretty much impossible.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gabriele

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: The router performs decently on most days. It has intermittent connectivity issues about once a month, but power cycling it usually fixes any issues. However, there is a design flaw in that the antenna connectors are flimsy. I was dusting and my hand accidentally hit the router. The antenna had broken. Upon further inspection, it's clear that the connector is tiny and fragile.
customer_reviews.author: Abishek

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. Haven't had any problems yet for approx. 2 months now. Asus still supports it with firmware updates, android app still works with it...etc. I also love the extra options available in the web interface, a definite plus compared to other competitors if you are not welling to flash your firmware with other third-party firmware: dd-wrt, tomato...etc. I've found that the firmware from the manufacturer is always more stable (issues include web interface freezing, drop connections...etc. You're reliant on the open community if you are using a third-party firmware. Also not the best option for someone who is not tech savvy). It's not a bad buy if you don't yet have a AC router.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a few months and then started dropping connections constantly. The router does not handle auto dns well anymore. You can test by setting dns on your device to 8.8.8.8. If that lets you have a connection and the router assigned dns does not, then that is a router problem. (Do not keep dns on 8.8.8.8). Many reviews here indicate a similar issue with dropped connections.
customer_reviews.author: Jethro K

customer_reviews.title: Range is not what I hoped
customer_reviews.text: The range is not what I hoped to get out of it. My neighbor has the same model across the street and I can get his strong signal at my house. I was hoping this unit would then work great all over my house but it does not. Sometimes it is difficult to get a strong signal in one of the upstairs room. It could be that this is due to my placement of the unit and the design of my house, but I expected that since I could get my neighbors signal at my house, then getting the same unit in my house would give me full range, but it does not. This is still a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME router. BUT read to update
customer_reviews.text: Awesome router. But doesn't update properly. Make sure you update the firmware manually. It's EASY. Go to [...] Now log into your router and Click the "Administration" link in left menu, then the "Firmware Upgrade" tab. Extract the zip file you downloaded. Now click "Choose File" and select the .trx file. Now click "Upload". That should do it! Just wait for the process to complete and you're good!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Turke

customer_reviews.title: Great router for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great router for the price. I didn't think the default firmware was perfect but it was better than many I've seen. I flashed this to asus-merlin and it works great. There are still a couple of bugs to workout like the ability to change a devices icon. I have 4 of the same 3com device's and one of them showed up as an asus device and was tagged with a asus name and asus icon while the other 3 were tagged correctly by default. I was able to change the name back to 3com but not the icon. Other than that it's been working great. I also was able to flash this to Tomato and DD-Wrt with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: JTL

customer_reviews.title: Great for large house
customer_reviews.text: We have a large house that needs several wifi networks to cover the entire space. Using three of these routers, we have a seamless system where a device can move from room to room and never lose the signal. The wifi "cell" automatically switches to the strongest signal. I've tried this with less capable routers and there have been lots of glitches. This one is perfect for large areas.
customer_reviews.author: EastMemphis

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, okay software, crappy support
customer_reviews.text: It took me forever to get this set up: the process of connecting it to the upstream device (cable modem, DSL modem, etc.) is very muck click-and-pray. When it goes wrong, there's no indication of why. Calling support resulted in a lot of "unplug everything and try again" advice. Eventually, some combination of unplugging and resetting works. The device is fantastic, but I wish the setup had been much smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rothman

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Easy to setup, and Blazing speed
customer_reviews.text: Noticeable improvement in speed over Comcast Modem. Bought this router because I use streaming services and this Wireless router had top marks for handling streaming devices in addition to having a good range. Setup is simple and straight forward, it took about 30 minutes to setup, I use MAC recognition on my main wireless network. This router also has a guest network which I promptly setup. The router has been working flawlessly the last month, handling two streaming devices at the same time without so much a hick-up. I have a one story house with a rather big foot print, the signal comes in strong from any location in the house. I highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Noturbizness

customer_reviews.title: A recommended wireless router.
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a new wireless router and looked at a variety of options. I have been very pleased with the operations of this router and the advanced settings that are available such as parental control. I have used this for over 30 days and have had no issues at all with the AC1750. I was impressed with the ease of setup and the web based interface that the ASUS offers and provides easy setup for static IP addresses for devices if you wish to set them up, as I do for my printer, thermostat, and other devices that don't leave the house.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K.

customer_reviews.title: Loses connection often.
customer_reviews.text: Always loses connection and I would have to reboot it every couple of days. It didn't even "play nicely" with a ASUS wireless adapter I bought for my PC. It would drop connections on that, my tv, XBOX, everything. I tried researching and changing settings, etc.... but nothing ever helped. I couldn't stand this router any more so I bought a Netgear C6250 and I haven't had a single issue with it for more than a year now. I will never, ever buy anything ASUS again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Frehr

customer_reviews.title: I don't have a good reference for comparison other than I replaced my Cincinnati ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a good reference for comparison other than I replaced my Cincinnati Bell combo unit (Zytel) with this Asus AC1750. Our 2.4 channels were all congested and I had major issues with speed degradation regardless of how I adjusted the settings. With the Cincinnati Bell unit I got ~20% of my rated speed at the modem. With this dual band unit I get ~95% or my rated speed regardless of where I am in the house. The only drawback is that I still have to use the modem portion of the Zytel unit and now have two black boxes.
customer_reviews.author: C. Michael

customer_reviews.title: It Will Break
customer_reviews.text: It sat, untouched and working for three years. Then the power button randomly broke and it is now impossible to turn on. I called and ASUS told me they would fix it for $129.99 + shipping (seriously, more than one currently sells for today). When I spent $200 three years ago, I expected it to last a bit longer. No thanks, I'll take my business elsewhere and I would suggest you do the same!
customer_reviews.author: Tom J

customer_reviews.title: Good Riddance
customer_reviews.text: Bought this two years ago after my Cisco product kept giving out. After two years of dealing with a horrendous interface, terrible connections, and constant reboots I am actually happy that the unit completely died on me this weekend. I am currently looking for a "next gen" router. I placed a pre-order for the Luma with Amazon a LONG, LONG time ago, but since the delivery dates have been constantly pushed back (and now completely eliminated), I am contemplating going with the Eero.
customer_reviews.author: CRP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router, excellent speeds and range
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router, excellent speeds and range. My only complaint is that when I shut it off, I have to reconnect the wireless settings (quick connect new internet set up), thus it always stays on. For range: walls aren't a problem and wifi hits everywhere in my 1200 sq foot residence. Router is in the office, TV and streaming is in the living room where the signal has 2-3 walls to deal with, but speeds stay consistent throughout. Great bang for the buck, and I should have upgraded from my old 2004 era linksys WRT something-G years ago to take advantage of higher internet speeds.
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router for multi-media streaming and business connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: The range is very good not AWESOME but very good. The real reason I purchased this on is I wanted better signal strength with all devices across wifi and direct connection. At any 1 time the router will have 20 or so wireless devices, two hard connected media servers (TiVo and Plex Media) and two IP phones. The performance increase has been VERY VERY noticeable. Speeds and connectivity on wireless signal are much better. Media server stream are improved. IP Phones seem to be a little better. It has a lot of great features but the most important feature is that it works when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, runs DD-WRT well, excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: I installed DD-WRT on this router and have been using it since August 2014 (currently end of June 2015, so approximately 10 months in production now). Excellent performance wired and wireless, hardware is very solid. I do experience intermittent device resets, and I haven't identified the root cause, however they may be related to PPPoE resets which I'm receiving from my ISP (so that would not indicate any real problem with the hardware). Regardless, they are infrequent enough that my family and I do not notice, and I work daily from my home office for 8+ hours. I will buy more of these, or possibly the newer units from ASUS, I'm very pleased with the experience thus far.
customer_reviews.author: K. Franzen

customer_reviews.title: Buggy port forwarding
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a Netgear WNDR3700. I have a Linux PC at home that acts as my mail server, among other things, so port forwarding is a must, and it was working fine on the WNDR3700. I immediately noticed problems connecting to my mail and SSH servers from work (which is on the same ISP in the same central office and about a 7 mS ping time away from home). Connections from work into my servers would sometimes work, and sometimes time out. I'd have to keep trying over and over to connect, then once connected, everything would be fine. I put my WNDR3700 back online and everything worked perfectly. I've decided to return the RT-AC66U.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: My home Asus router boots me off wifi for no reason. This Asus quit working after about 2 .weeks. Started having issues wth wifi, and internet. Rebooted, couldn't even log into router hard reset multiple times. Set up from scratch again..... same issue after a couple of days. Went to staples and got a net gear. Has been fine ever since (about .3 months now). Save your money. Lots of nice features, ability to limit bandwidth on select users, but who cares if the whole thing craps out. I will never buy another asus
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: So - So
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace an aging Linksys WRT54GL that would crash when kids and grandkids filled the house with their handheld devices. Also hoped to get better coverage in my workshop about 100' away. No more crashes. However, the distance is no better. Recently had an issue where I couldn't access a specific website whether I was connected wirelessly or wired. I tried multiple browsers and multiple devices with no luck. I didn't suspect the Asus, so I called my cable internet provider (after power cycling their modem). After some tests, they suggested I power cycle the Asus. That eliminated the problem. Strange! I probably wouldn't buy another one of these knowing what I know now.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carl

customer_reviews.title: Fine for first 2 months and then it makes noise like an insect!
customer_reviews.text: The router was fine for first 2 months, and now I hear a creaking voice from it every 2 seconds. It sounds like a fly flapping its wings on the glass. It is very annoying noise. It feels like there is an insect in the house, unfortunately my return policy is gone as per amazon. I feel I have a defective item.! I actually searched for the keyword "noise" in the reviews for this product and I see several people have complained about it! Well I am not alone then, there is something wrong in this, the buzzing sound is very annoying, especially at night when it is quite all around.
customer_reviews.author: Vikram

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Can handle multiple devices, PS3 gaming, laptop gaming, and phone connections at the same time. I actually have this in another room of the house than most of the devices and have no issue with lost or dropped connections. Be aware that your ISP may not support servicing to your "own" router. I have Charter-Spectrum, but they cannot run diagnostics past the modem. Just something to think about if you're considering purchasing your own router instead of paying a $5 ish/month fee to "rent" one.
customer_reviews.author: JENTHEBRILLIANT

customer_reviews.title: Product good, tech support terrible
customer_reviews.text: The router works great so far. Why 3 stars? We had trouble setting it up and customer service/technical support sucks. They won't help you with their product unless you PAY them. Really? This is how you want to get loyal customers? Support your product. That is a better way to get loyal, returning customers instead of charging for support because the directions are horrible. We finally found the information we needed on the internet. That was WAY more helpful than the company's technical support. If you are pretty tech savvy, then it is a good router. If you are not tech savvy, then you can learn from our experience.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Russell

customer_reviews.title: Did some research and this was a highly rated model ...
customer_reviews.text: Did some research and this was a highly rated model. The setup process walks you through the most important settings and it was up and running in minutes. The administrative interface is much more advanced than my older Netgear router, and the dual band is a real plus, especially as the older bands are heavily used. Unfortunately, does not allow you to block websites when you use https instead of just http, but neither did my Netgear. So far, it's worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great, has great features
customer_reviews.text: It works great, has great features.. but it didn't give me better wifi coverage of my small apartment then the stock wifi router from my cable company, and that was kind of the point. This doesn't actually have any must have features or anything that makes it stand out, really dissapointed in the signal strength compared to a crappy 15$ router.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: another failed ON/OFF switch here. and i'm out of ...
customer_reviews.text: another failed ON/OFF switch here. and i'm out of warranty. not that i could have been without a router long enough for it to make the round trip journey to Asus and back, anyways. i'm using ULTRA HIGH TECH for a fix--jammed a TOOTHPICK in the switch to keep the power button on. yup, it really works. Contemplating a fix that involves a big heavy rock and a sudden stop after a short, swift fall. sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan C.

customer_reviews.title: The best router I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a lot of ASUS products over my time as a computer tech, but I was a bit skeptical when I saw this product. Previously I'd been a loyal Dlink adherent. Dlink had not been impressing me with the last two (high end consumer) routers I'd purchased from their lines. So I figured I'd give the 'new guy' a shot. I've been very impressed with this router, the functions and features are top notch, and considering I basically have it in a hole it still covers my whole house from the basement. I would recommend this router to anyone who wants a bit more than just the cheap plastic crap the phone company or cable provider gives you.
customer_reviews.author: Russell I

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The product works great.....almost. The routeris working great, fast connection, easy to use web interface, and importantly...no drop connections. The only problems that I have encountered so far is that sometimes the router would make a buzzing noise which can be heard from 4ft away. I have contacted Asus support and so far it is a mixed bag, the first customer rep gave me a solution that did not fix the problem, so I contacted them back and have been waiting for a reply for 2 weeks now. I have tried contacting them again and will see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great once I got a working item
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item refurbished. It lasted about two days and then died. As in, it shut off in the middle of the night, and never turned back on. Amazon customer service was surprisingly terrible, and I ended up returning it and buying it from an Amazon competitor whose name starts with New and ends with egg. It cost more, but a month later, it works great. Its the best router I've ever bought. I have not had a single dropped signal in a month, and speeds are better than ever. If you are looking to buy this refurbished, do yourself a favor and just buy a new one with a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Allen

customer_reviews.title: easy setup works perfectly with arris surfboard cable modem
customer_reviews.text: Purchased about a month ago, easy setup works perfectly with arris surfboard cable modem, Instantly doubled my DL speed over an older netgear. I'm around 120 D/8 U on xfinity. I mainly use it hardwired for xbox one and a gaming pc. Wifi end cell and firestick both run better the only thing Ive noticed my signal isn't the best further away from the unit but I don't have it localized in my house. Second asus product I purchased also have a Rog Strix motherboard very happy with there products never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Router reboots itself constantly. Tried factory reset + firmware upgrades with no luck. No worth buying. Update: Went to a third party firmware (not Merlin) all seems to be working well so far, no reboot for 60 minutes!!!! Yay! Update 2: It has been while since the firmware upgrades, has to run through a few more. Router was functional with no issues for a couple of months, just required a reboot every month or so. After this month's regular reboot the router restarted in Recovery Mode and has since stayed there, so far running through the recommended steps to recovery have not worked. (loading same firmware, factory firmware, recovery tool, etc). Don't buy this router. -AC
customer_reviews.author: A. Cornejo

customer_reviews.title: OK router, failed in an odd manner
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a couple of years but then slowly started failing. The wireless signals were alright and allowed me to connect to the router and manage the router but it would not connect to the internet. A hard reset fixed it for a few minutes. But then it stopped routing traffic to the internet. After spending a couple of hours I determined that the ethernet ports had failed including the WAN port. The lights and all seem to work, the wireless is also working. I think If I do another reset, it'll probably work for a few more minutes. But after 3 hours and a wasted night I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy_Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Lemon. DON'T PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.text: The router is a complete lemon. I used it for a while and got the three lights of death (it's a real thing). Asked ASUS to honor their RMA. Got cold responses back from customer support telling me that I needed to foot the bill to repair their bad hardware. No, thank you! Save your money and buy a router from a more reliable manufacturer who cares about their customers. ASUS is hardly a company you'd want to deal with. You'll thank yourself after not having to deal with ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: N. B. Standiford

customer_reviews.title: It's range is awesome. I always had problems reaching some places at ...
customer_reviews.text: Just have everything you need, with Download Manager (that you can tell your modem to download something to your HD (like torrent or another type of download) even when you are not at home. It's range is awesome. I always had problems reaching some places at my home. With this router this problem is over. Even not the latest, I think for it's price it's worth more then it's newer version (unless you really want 4K video sharing or some other stuff). I'm using it for more then 2 years without any problem or complain until now.
customer_reviews.author: Fizard

customer_reviews.title: The warranty process is bulky and slow.
customer_reviews.text: I lasted 3 months. It is dead. I am sending it in for warranty repair. I am paying for the shipping. When fixed, they will send it back via Fed-ex ground. That means that I will be without a router for at least 2 weeks. They need a better process.
customer_reviews.author: Marguerite Fenton

customer_reviews.title: Filter this, FIOS
customer_reviews.text: Awesome router. It's fast and has all the features you would want from a premium router. The interface that ships with this is fairly robust - one thing in particular that I really liked was network-shared USB storage and printers. I got this specific router for the sole purpose of flashing it with the "Merlin" firmware in order to get network-wide VPN. I've been using it for a long time now - support for PPP, OpenVPN, etc. I'm on FIOS and they tend to throttle certain types of traffic, so whenever I notice that I flip the VPN switch on the router and voila, XBox One traffic goes over my private VPN and my connection is 10x better in matches.
customer_reviews.author: Justin R

customer_reviews.title: Solid connection through several walls
customer_reviews.text: Great router. I work remotely and need a stable connection since I can't plug directly into the router in my new apartment. My last router had connection drops all the time so I upgraded to this one. Since upgrading there hasn't been any connection issues and the signal has to go 50ish feet through several walls. Also, from a security standpoint, they seem to update their firmware whenever a vulnerability comes out. The firmware upgrade is pretty easy as well. The only thing it lacks is an alert when a new firmware update is available. But I set up a Google alert so NBD.
customer_reviews.author: NvyMn

customer_reviews.title: Website says Time Machine support. Website is WRONG
customer_reviews.text: The website (and the Firmware page) will indicate Apple Time Machine support. After two conversations with support, this does not support that feature. Customer service was willing to apologize, but I doubt they'll even fix their website to show the actual feature set of this router. This happened with the ASUS RT66U too. Stay away from these if you're an Apple user. They have no idea how to support these things.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ross

customer_reviews.title: Owned for 6 months!!! No problems
customer_reviews.text: This router does everything is says it does and has excellent range. I have several mobile devices and PCs, a blu-ray, and 2 consoles, as well as 2 USB harddrives all the time and it keeps up just fine. Its easy to set up and has plenty of advanced settings. Only reason I am leaving this is to try and offset all the negative reviews because as everyone knows if you have a negative experience you are more than likely going to warn people about it. I will say that this router is great and I have been recommending it to all my friends and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Zach M

customer_reviews.title: Great, until it died.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June of 2014. I immediately flashed it to DD-WRT and it worked great. It never crashed, had great range and the speeds were very good. Not a complaint to be had. That was until Feb. of 2015 with it died. Certainly not the life expectancy that is acceptable to me. Since I flashed it to DD-WRT I'm not filing a warranty claim but that has nothing to do with it dying as I've ran it on numerous routers for years. It's been replaced with a Netgear R7000. If it would have had a longer life span I'd love it but not surviving a full year is just unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Boomhower

customer_reviews.title: Great router, power switch breaks easily which makes it unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: Great router, easy to configure, powerful. However power switch broke so no longer works. I found several other posts about Asus router power switches breaking on internet.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Good router but has complicated setup if you don't know what your doing!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good router for the most part. I get pretty good speeds and range. I just had a difficult time getting it set up just right. You have to make sure you have the right firmware, I had to download and install the merlin version of it. I'm still kind of on the fence with this router though because I'm consirned about the speed on the 2.4ghz its not as stable with speed as I would like it to be. I have a very busy house with lots of WiFi devices connected anf it seams to do the job. I'm getting very good download speed on Steam and that makes me very happy!
customer_reviews.author: August

customer_reviews.title: Too pricey to die after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: After paying $200 for the "best" router, the ASUS RT-AC66U worked for almost 18 months with long range and good speed. As described by many other buyers, the RT-AC66U eventually runs into a problem where it loses the internet connection. After several rounds with ASUS Technical Support of replacing firmware and resetting factory settings, they offered to pay to send out my unit for repairs without giving me a replacement unit. Apparently ASUS doesn't have the "pay $30 and we'll rush you a refurbished unit" kind of policy. They didn't seem to understand how unacceptable being without a wireless router is (I have a work at home business). It will be a long time before I purchase another ASUS product.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Lucas

customer_reviews.title: I've had multiple routers of multiple brands in the past and simply never had any problem like this. Range and speed are good fo
customer_reviews.text: Port forwarding simply doesn't work on mine. I tried multiple firmware versions as well as the non-ASUS version of DD-WRT. I've had multiple routers of multiple brands in the past and simply never had any problem like this. Range and speed are good for connections, and I like the interface and large number of options -- but the lack of functional port forwarding caused me to use this to upgrade my access point and buy another router as my primary.
customer_reviews.author: Tim V

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up, Great Range.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing router. Set up was extremely easy. Signal strength covers my entire house (2 story 2200 sq ft.) I have connected a Windows desktop, a Mac Mini, Apple TV, several phones, and several laptops with no issues. The highest speed I have recorded is 121 MBPS (granted this depends more on your ISP) while my previous router was only able to deliver around 10 MBPS (same computer, tested through speedtest.net)
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: No problems, good web interface, fast
customer_reviews.text: I am getting 29 mbps through wifi, which almost as fast as the 30 mbps I get with a wired connection. The device has a good web interface, and it has been trouble free since I bought it several moths ago. The Asus-WRT firmware has a feature to enable SSH, which lets me actually log in to the router and use Linux commands to see what it is doing. That has absolutely no practical use for me, but I find it kind of fun.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect home router
customer_reviews.text: Could not be happier with this router. I work from home and am a heavy data user. We also stream and game over this. I've not had a single connection drop or found this router to be the cause of in game latency. I have a VPN connection to my office running 24/7 and it hasn't dropped once in over a month. More settings than most home users will ever need but also a great first time use wizard. Accepts USB storage which can be used as a highly configurable network share and works as a print server for USB printers. Might seem a little pricey but nothing cheaper will compare.
customer_reviews.author: P.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome router!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing router! Previously had a cheap one and I constantly had to restart it and the internet would get very slow when multiple devices were connected. I've had this one going on three years now and have only had to restart it MAYBE twice the entire time and I think it ended up being an modem problem not a router one. I can have as many devices connected as I want and the internet doesn't noticeably slow down at all!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: 5Ghz is not for you if you have a large house
customer_reviews.text: Sounded like the best thing in 5GHz and got this to move on from my old 2.4Ghz 1000mW N system -- however I find the range and speed to be slower with the AC66U compared to the old system. The "transmit rate" (which you see on a mac with option-click on the wifi icon) is reliably always 20Mb slower than the old system unless im less than 25 ft from the router. The range also is much shorter and where my old system covers the entire house front and back garden, then ASUS struggles to cover just my house. I tried to upgrade with high gain antennas (9DBi 5GHz antennas) however that didn't make any noticeable difference.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Warp Speed! LOL!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just amazing!!! Hooked this up to my Motorola modem and FINALLY realized the full potential of my internet speed! Seems as though the 2.4 ghz band isn't able to cope with my 100 mbps speed. I only would see 20-30 mbps using speed tests. Switched over to the 5ghz band and up the speed went to 100+!!! Just bought another one of these units. Set up relatively easy using the many video's and instructions online. My set up didn't just pop up like some have experienced but Asus' set up site was relatively easy to navigate.
customer_reviews.author: D.S.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Asus makes great stuff and this router is no exception. In particular, I wanted DD-WRT availability. I stuck with the stock firmware because DD-WRT has some extra stuff that I don't need and Asus has continually updated the firmware. I use it behind a pfsense firewall. The parental controls work well to fence the kids into certain hours. The QoS works okay too, but it have more detailed settings. Most of all, it's a fast router and has a lot of bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: I. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Feature Rich router
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router! Updated with the open source Merlin build. I have this router behind our ATT modem gateway in pass-though mode. Still had to declare the network port services (https, ssh, etc) on the modem gateway. The Asus AC66U has great range and more features than most people will ever need. The difference between connecting wireless on "g" and "n" or "ac" is noticeably apparent. Better streaming, better throughput on data transfers. The AC66U has been a great addition to my home network. Although it was a good chunk of change, it has been worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Matt K

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good router
customer_reviews.text: We bought this router because our old one (a Linksys WRT54G running hacked firmware), although it still worked fine for most purposes, was having issues streaming video. A perusal of the reviews of various routers indicated that Cisco / Linksys was no longer an optimum choice. The ASUS got good reviews, and although my first inclination was to just buy the "n" model, the 'ac" being only $30 more made me decide to invest in the ability to upgrade later. Other than this......the router just works. It's extremely easy to set up, and the streaming issues disappeared. The four stars on the review are for what I regard as an excessively high price.
customer_reviews.author: rico567

customer_reviews.title: Simple, steady, fast
customer_reviews.text: After upgrading my Internet service to 60mb/s, my old D-Link DIR-825 router started dropping connections with various of my devices. I tried upgrading to longer antennas, and although that slightly increased the signal strength, it didn't solve the randomly dropped connections. That's why I decided to upgrade to this Asus router. It was simple to set up. Now I have all of my devices--two TVs, two blu-ray players, two iPads, one android tablet, two iPhones, one Internet land phone, three computers, and one printer--all connected at the new, fast speed. I have had no dropped connections in three days of continuous service. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great router. Easy to configure for neophytes.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this router for several months now. The unit works very well. Great ability to reach all parts of my two story home. The router is located at one end of the house on the upper floor and reaches the farthest room with ease. (4/5 bars), It does get warm, and heat is the enemy of electronics, so I bought a USB powered fan, connected it to the USB port on the router, aimed it at the backside (to hide from view). Voila, problem solved! The fan is available on Amazon as well, and is good insurance to add additional life expectancy.
customer_reviews.author: E. Tavano

customer_reviews.title: best residential router!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely powerful router and in conjunction with the Motorola Surfboard DOCSIS 3.0 cable modems, cranks up my internet speeds by about 30% and extends the range. The UI is great and intuitive but if you're a networking nube like me, it'll take some time to figure out how to optimize all the settings, even as easy to navigate as it is...I had my network engineer buddy configure mine! it does generate a bit of heat so if possible, I'd recommend putting a fan on it...I used dual 80mm USB powered fans for the cooler guys which I also bought on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: ci-lee

customer_reviews.title: Router great -- ASUS support RUDE!
customer_reviews.text: Nice router with a strong wi-fi signal. The only reason I gave it a 3 is because the support folks at ASUS are rude and wanted to charge me just to answer a couple of questions. I said no and read some more. Figured it out but will not purchase any ASUS network products again. The network products are supported by a third party company who don't want to be bothered.
customer_reviews.author: Hal R.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement four our seriously outdated router of a different brand. I work from home using internet and voip, we have 3 additional computers, 4 mobile phones, 2 XBOX. Our old router would barely hold 2 wireless devices. This was relatively simple for me to set up. All devices can access the internet at the same time, speed has improved, lag reduced. Of course we have no 5ghz AC devices at this time, so I cannot rate the speed on that, but otherwise I love it so far. Lots of neat features my outdated router did not have. Only bad thing is now that my family has their technology back, so I don't see them anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself time and aggravation
customer_reviews.text: I started with the Asus RT-N66U and initially loved it. I started experiencing connection issues over Wifi after 4 months. Thought I got a unit that was going bad...bought this newer model. After a few days the intermittent connection over WiFi (5 and 2.4) made it useless for our small office of 1300 sq ft. I tried everything I knew. Changed channels, upgraded firmware, rebooted... replaced it with Airport Extreme and seems to be working fine. Just packed this unit for return/refund to Amazon. I really wanted to like this router. Love the user interface but what good is it if the connection is unstable? You may have better luck with Asus but I won't be buying their router again.
customer_reviews.author: chardad318

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far, easy too configure
customer_reviews.text: So far, it has been fantastic easy to setup, I used the same SSID's and passwords as the one that bricked (Netgear N900) and everything came up and connected instantly. the USB ports solved an old printer issue, M HP Officejet 4620 would constantly drop off the network and need to be powered down, and back up so you could print to it, a known issue. I set it up on the USB port, LPR printing, and now, I never need to power cycle the printer, it wakes right up and prints. it has only been running for a month, but I am very pleased so far
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: A really good wired and wireless router
customer_reviews.text: I have had this installed for a few months now and really love it. I have wired, wireless, multiple networks, OpenVPN and numerous other features being used. So far everything is working well and was easy to install and get working. I have not noticed any dropout, and bandwidth seems to be strong and steady.
customer_reviews.author: outgolfn

customer_reviews.title: Buy This, Not Netgear
customer_reviews.text: If you are a first time router user, like myself, and are willing to pay for the features on this router - you can't go wrong. I wrote a scathing review of the Netgear router I purchased first (and returned - thank you Amazon) due to the company being unethically and knowingly providing malfunctioning firm ware that needs a router expert willing to spend their valuable time and effort to repair, while getting worthless support. This router resolves all those problems and is easy to install before being sold to the public. Not only that, the customer support personnel actually speak real English rather than a heavily accented mixture of some other language. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: OP

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Loads of features
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup. Features by the boat load (most I'll never use). Gets quite hot though... Signal doesn't seem to cover very far but if you're within 30+ feet it's fast and reliable. Probably a good idea to get this up and away from other stuff for a better signal. Had USB drive plugged in for a bit of fun with streaming and cloud research. Worked fine but not something I really need right now so I'm pretty much just using this as a high end multi-band router/firewall. Parental controls are pretty decent, but a bit of time to invest with ip's/mac addresses if you have a shload of devices like me...
customer_reviews.author: JDS

customer_reviews.title: Good Speed and Range for 1800 sqft home
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router since I was having problems with blind spot at my home which is a duplex. I even purchased a powerline to solve my problem. I found having two SSID for my old router and powerline is two troublesome so I decided to buy this router. I am impressed on the speed and range having 80 percent signal strength where it is usually a dead zone from one end other the house to the other separated by two walls and the router being in the second floor and ps4 in the first. I would definitely recommend this router for those looking to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: E. Arana

customer_reviews.title: Good, fast solid router.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice router. Using the provided CD I was able to get it up and running in about 5 minutes. In addition to the easy setup the interface for changing the router settings is easy to use. In addition to its ease of use I found this router to be very fast compared to my old router which was about three years old. I was able to get over 100MBPS on this router which is a lot faster than the 30 I got on my old system. If you are looking for a great router I would recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Jex

customer_reviews.title: cant get it to maintain any wifi connections...update: problem now solved
customer_reviews.text: Update: After taking under 10 minutes to call ASUS support they walked me through tweaking a few settings & that appears to have solved it. I'm still knocking off a star because it was not plug & play ready. I really wanted to like this router but I cant get it to maintain any wifi connections (two cell phones & two wifi internet radios). It will allow connections but then soon after will drop them. Wired connections are all fine. And yes, I updated the firmware first thing out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: JB in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Easy !
customer_reviews.text: WOW! What a great router. super easy to set up. I was freaking out thinking it would take all this time and hassle to re-connect all my devices. Not true, it was simple. The only small irritation I ran into was that my wireless printer would only accept a 7 character password. of course I didn't know this until after I had already finalized my new router password. I really wanted a more complexed password but couldn't due to the printer I have(Brother). I guess I need to get a new printer. all in all a really great experience. So far the streaming is flawless and that's real reason I bought the router.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Haynes

customer_reviews.title: power switch failed
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 6 of these routers and 2 of them had the power switch failed. The switch was used about 10 times on each one and the power switch failed in the power off position. Aside from that, the router worked great.
customer_reviews.author: PC Solutions

customer_reviews.title: Wow....great router
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an aging D-Link Gamer 5400? router with this one and it's impressive. I was able to plug it into power in my kitchen, load the iPhone app to assign an IP and have all the other basic settings configured before I even made it to my office. Once there, I plugged in my modem and viola, I was on the Interwebs. I've noticed that the factory radio gets me a wifi signal on my iPhone 4S 2 houses away, increasing it slightly gets me about 4 houses away. Incredible. The old D-Link didn't make it through my back yard's 1/2 way point. Very impressive and simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dissent

customer_reviews.title: Very good router made better by 3rd party firmware
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router based on performance and reviews. Performance was great but WiFi and remote connections (and ASUS firmware) were consistently unstable even after several ASUS firmware updates. The ASUS firmware frequently required resets to default settings to get WiFi and/or remote access to work. Since downloading and installing alternative firmware for this router (Merlin's Tower from lostrealm-dot-ca), this unit now lives up to promises and has provided reliable connections for several weeks now. ASUS hardware seems solid, Merlin firmware makes it better.
customer_reviews.author: G. Skala

customer_reviews.title: Excellent DD-WRT router
customer_reviews.text: Best router I've ever bought. Was a bit of a pain to force an old firmware install that would allow DD-WRT to install, but it's been flawless for over a year since.
customer_reviews.author: Zeus

customer_reviews.title: Great GREAT product, Terrible customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I went with this router because i am familiar with the quality of Asus products. The router itself was easy enough to setup with quite the variety of options including a cloud storage option. What i didnt like was when i went to use said storage, it prompted me for a user/password. Setting up this router pretty much makes it so you would have 3 sets of these, which i tried, and got nowhere. I searched the FAQs with no result and finally called ASUS themselves. The customer service rep knew absolutely nothing about what i was talking about and in the end couldnt help me. Heres to ASUS knowing their own products.
customer_reviews.author: Fydelity

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I had an old LINKSYS WRT160NL and wanted to upgrade to a new Gigabyte router. I tried the LINKSYS (CISCO) EA6500 "Smart" router. It was not very smart and took hours to set up with IP cameras. It would not allow access to the cameras within the network using a DNS SERVER. The signal was weak. I returned it and bought this ASUS which is awesome. Setup was easy. All cameras accessible from inside or outside the network. Fast fast fast. I also bought the extra long antennas separately for an added boost. Be sure to get cat 6 cables to take full advantage of the speed and bandwidth even though your modem may not output gigabyte speed - yet.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for one year exactly. It's been a constant problem. Constant WAN drops (probably 10 times) each time requiring a factory reset and total reconnect of every wireless device, TV's Sono system, etc. It will also just randomly need WPS password resets to get anything to connect to it. Tried different firmware, no change. I'll try and get a refund, but not likely going to happen. Do your homework, I'm not the only one having this same issue. Asus won't do anything about it either.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and afforadable
customer_reviews.text: We just ordered 7 of these to cover over 4000,000sq ft in our plant. We have many thick concrete walls and floor over 12" thick. This units performance is outstanding and we are very happy with the performance. We measure 1 of these units covering almost 90,000sq feet of open warehouse space. We ordered bigger antennas to extend the coverage(Super Power Supply® 3 x 9dBi 2.4GHz 5GHz Dual Band WiFi RP-SMA Antenna for Routers ASUS RT-N16 RT-N66U RT-AC66U RT-AC1750 D-Link DIR-655 DIR-665 Buffalo WZR-HP-G450H TP-Link TL-WR1043ND TL-WR2543ND TL-WDR4300 Omni Directional Network Extension Mini PCIe PCI Cards Wireless WAN Repeater).
customer_reviews.author: CHANG

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, great range, great speed
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old actiontec router for my fios connection with this one (after going through the data over ethernet provisioning). I no longer have issues with poor coverage from the more distant machines in my home, and connected with astreaming and network access from my media center (TV, tivo, bluray, xbox) works flawlessly. Traffic monitoring and other support is nice, but at the end of the day I got this to be a fast, reliable router, and I am pleased. The USB ports are convenient, setting up an external hard drive to be a network drive for backups was no problem.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bane

customer_reviews.title: Fast, but be careful with firmware updates
customer_reviews.text: I moved to a new apartment that offered 100 megabit or 1 gigabit internet. Needless to say, my old WRT54GL choked and I had to buy a new router after seven or eight years. Considering how often I'm home and what I usually do, 100 megabit is just fine for me. I'll consistently pull 100 up, 100 down. I haven't had a chance to set up VPN yet, but curious to see how that will go. -1 star for a bad firmware update that made it so I had to restart the router on a daily basis to maintain connectivity. Another firmware update resolved the issue - but not before wiping the router clean of all settings.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: I watched the YouTube videos that ASUS created beforehand but didn't really need to because it is so easy. Connect all of the ca
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a breeze! I purchased this for a not-so-tech-savy friend and was dreading the install because he has Comcast. I watched the YouTube videos that ASUS created beforehand but didn't really need to because it is so easy. Connect all of the cables, connect your laptop to the new wireless network, enter the PIN on the bottom of the router and then launch your browser. Easy peasy... There are plenty of settings that you can customize and tweak for better performance, but for a novice user that won't be doing any heavy streaming, you can probably just use all of the defaults and be happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Finally replacing my WRT54G...
customer_reviews.text: Easy-ish setup. I was trying to set it up without disturbing my existing, working setup. After resetting the router and my modem a couple times to get them talking properly, I just had to remember that after enabling the secure login, that I had to access the router on  instead. Wireless speeds seem fast so far. After comparing wireless Internet speeds before and after installation I discovered that Comcast had applied the wrong speed package to my account. Otherwise, lots of features on this router! Can't wait to try them all out!
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: Tried all of the flagships I think before settling on this one. Flawless, full featured, and those features are actually well thought out and WORK, rather than just being enough to squeak by for marketing. Good speed on the USB3 storage, decent FTP server in a pinch (though it only allows directories to be created under /SP_UFD_U3/...), no issues setting up with dynamic DNS or port forwarding. Aside: I was using a range extender with my old router, which is now in a box - no longer needed!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Calzone

customer_reviews.title: Over all best for your money.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of the used amazon warehouse deals units. First off one would never know it is used looks brand new, including the packing. With that said I was dealing with a linksys ea6300, complete waist of time and money. Now for the Asus, once installed I reset the unit to factory default settings before attempting to configure anything. Initial setup to about 3 minutes, I spent a few hours tweaking settings after that to my liking. This router has received so many positive reviews that in not even going to bother going into details of how well it preforms. Let's just say it's best in class in every way.
customer_reviews.author: DrewG5

customer_reviews.title: Not because it didn't work great but because it wasn't what I needed
customer_reviews.text: To be honest and fair, we ended up returning this. Not because it didn't work great but because it wasn't what I needed. This is a perfect, state of the art wireless router. The signal was strong and steady. Unfortunately, what I needed was a modem/router which this was not. That was why it was returned. No fault of the product, just me not properly researching.
customer_reviews.author: NamiesBooks

customer_reviews.title: Great router so far.
customer_reviews.text: Things I like - Easy to set up. - Lots of configuration options -- does a lot more stuff than any router I've ever owned. I think a lot of the features are usually found only on commercial-grade routers. - Very good Tx/Rx, much better than my old Cisco/Linksys even at default gain setting (gain is adjustable). Only two complaints: - Couldn't get the product registered at the ASUS website--kept saying invalid s/n when I know I entered it correctly. - Like many Chinese companies ASUS apparently does think the expense of really good translation services to be justifiable, so the documentation, while readable, isn't very good.
customer_reviews.author: huntml

customer_reviews.title: If you know what it is, it does what it says - so buy it.
customer_reviews.text: The product works great. The only thing holding me back from giving it 5 stars is there has been a firmware update for 6 months now and my router just cannot install it. I've given up trying to get it downloaded, as I've reinstalled everything and reset the router from scratch which is annoying to say the least and still not gotten the newest firmware updated. This doesn't really hold it back, it helps me do what I want to do with it. Its just annoying every time I change a setting on my router having to see that light that says there is new firmware available.
customer_reviews.author: KushielAOC

customer_reviews.title: Great router, easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Great router, easy to setup, runs fast and the interface is quite intuitive. However i bought this router with the hopes of using it with a VPN service as it said it is VPN ready but they mean a VPN into your own private network and not a service like strongvpn. You can still flash the router and load DD-WRT on it or tomato to use a VPN service but it does not look easy and i guess would void your warranty at the risk of bricking the router. All things said i am still happy with the purchase, the router has a quality look and feel but it does run a bit hot.
customer_reviews.author: VJ

customer_reviews.title: In the past I've stuck to Linksys wireless accesspoints for home but this time I ventured away due to great reviews elsewhere wh
customer_reviews.text: This router packs some punch in features and range. In the past I've stuck to Linksys wireless accesspoints for home but this time I ventured away due to great reviews elsewhere which were well deserved. I'm able to setup wireless for my family's use along with guest access that is restricted quite easily. Live in a neighborhood with lots of people running wireless nearby, well this beauty's dual band capabilities and MIMO with external antennas gets rid of that problem (for the devices that support 5Ghz anyways). Updates are a breeze and love the usb file/printer sharing support. For the real geeks out there IPv6 is supported.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Must have internet connection, not good for non internet use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use as a sound Wireless Network to interface two devices without an internet connection. Unfortunately this device requires an internet connection to properly function. I'm sure taht's great for a home network, but I needed it for a professional setting, which is why I purchased a far too expensive router with ultra fast bandwidth. I now have 3 antennaes attached to a paper weight. Since our theater was under renovation I didn't find this out until 6 months after purchase. Not likely buying any ASUS anything again.
customer_reviews.author: TWonton

product_meta.title: ASUS RT-AC66U_B1 Dual and 802.11ac Router with ASUS AiCloud (4 Ports Gigabits, USB Ports, SAMBA, DLNA, Printer Server, Ftp Server, VPN Server, Multiple SSID) - Black
product_meta.description:
Style Name:AC1750 Mbps Dual-BandASUS RT-AC66U Dual and 802.11ac Router with ASUS AiCloud (Four Ports Gigabits, USB Ports, SAMBA, DLNA, Printer Server, Ftp Server, VPN Server, Multiple SSID) - Black

LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Product is sourced and shipped from the European Economic Area (EEA). Product is genuine original from manufacturer authorized distributors.

BOX CONTAINS
RT-AC66U Dual Band 3x3 802.11AC Gigabit Router
Router stand
RJ-45 cable
Support CD (User manual and utility software)
Power adapter
Quick start guide

See more
feature_bullets: 5th generation 802.11ac chipset gives you concurrent dual-band 2.4 GHz/5 GHz for up to fast 1.75 Gbps
File sharing, printer sharing and 3G sharing via two multi-functional built-in USB ports
Download Master for wireless data storage and access to your router-connected USB storage devices. Network standard: IEEE 802.11a, IEEE 802.11b, IEEE 802.11g, IEEE 802.11n, IEEE 802.11ac, IPv4, IPv6
Enjoy the ASUSWRT dashboard UI for three steps easy setup, signal monitoring and network application control
ASUS AiCloud service: Access, stream, share, sync - all on-the-go with unlimited storage expansion
